> The diff coverage is `n/a`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3000/graphs/tree.svg?width=650&height=150&src=pr&token=WdLKlKHOAU)](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3000?src=pr&el=tree)

```diff

==========================================

==========================================

==========================================

+ Misses       3312     3301      -11
```

| [airflow/utils/helpers.py](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3000/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-YWlyZmxvdy91dGlscy9oZWxwZXJzLnB5) | `54.02% <0%> (+2.87%)` | :arrow_up: |
| [airflow/task/task\_runner/bash\_task\_runner.py](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3000/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-YWlyZmxvdy90YXNrL3Rhc2tfcnVubmVyL2Jhc2hfdGFza19ydW5uZXIucHk=) | `100% <0%> (+6.66%)` | :arrow_up: |

> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3000?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [6d88744...0550ec7](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3000?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
I created a [JIRA](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2057) for your PR. Please modify your commit message with the JIRA name : AIRFLOW-2057 so I can merge your PR. Thanks!

For starters, I don't think using socket.getfqdn() is the right thing to do. Instead, we should store IP addresses.

According to the documentation: https://docs.python.org/2/library/socket.html#socket.getfqdn

> Return a fully qualified domain name for name. If name is omitted or empty, it is interpreted as the local host. To find the fully qualified name, the hostname returned by `gethostbyaddr()` is checked, followed by aliases for the host, if available. The first name which includes a period is selected. In case no fully qualified domain name is available, the hostname as returned by `gethostname()` is returned.

We cannot rely on the consistency of `getfqdn()`'s output and should use IP address instead.

@jgao54 Any reason why we chose to use the hostname instead of IP address?
@jgao54 @l1990790120 Please check the screenshot: `getfqdn()`'s output is not consistent.
Thanks!
@bolkedebruin Any thoughts?

@Fokko Hello, I did add a unit test. Tell me if it is ok.
+1, thanks @kaxill, LGTM for 2.0.
Thanks for the contribution. Could you prepend the commit with the Jira ticket? `[AIRFLOW-1793] ...`

Thanks @AetherUnbound 

Could you fix the flake8 violations?
@cinhil It looks ok. My last question is, why didn't this cause issues earlier on?
Thanks!
I'll merge, a very nice addition to the BigQuery operator.

@Fokko The complete answer:
```
>>> import datetime
>>> datetime.datetime.now().isoformat()
'2018-02-02T10:22:51.531638'
>>> import pendulum
>>> pendulum.now('Europe/Brussels').isoformat()
'2018-02-02T10:23:35.185398+01:00'
```
Ah, that makes sense. This is due the recent timezone improvements that @bolkedebruin made
Done.
On it!

Need to think through how to manage this. We don't have a 2.0 branch so far. Merging into master would put this on track for 1.10, which we don't want due to compatibility issues. I'm going to leave this open for the time being. If we cut 1.10 soon, then we can merge it in, else we might have to create a 2.0 branch and have you change the PR to point to the 2.0 branch rather than master.

@criccomini Sure we can do that. Or else we can keep the files as they are but also create an integrated file and then we can delete all the single GCS files in Airflow 2.0. But yes I am happy to do it either way.
@Fokko I believe this is ready to be merged now

Hello @bolkedebruin ,
I did not find already another one but I am new on airflow and try to make it works for timezone dependent batches. I am facing another timezone issue described by https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2060 but I do not thing it is related directly to this one.

I should do the same for mark_success_url in models.py. Probably affected the same way that log_url. In which screen it is used ?
Edit: I found it, it is in the email alert. I will push the fix later today.
Edit: Done
@Fokko Thank you for reviewing and merging it.

Go. LGTM

@Fokko rebase done, test passed. lgtm.

Thanks @cinhil  We had some recent updates with the pendulum library.

Cheers
cc @Fokko @fenglu-g @criccomini @jgao54

@ashb  thanks for testing this! 
@milanvdm this should take care of #2877 as well, would be great if you got a chance to double-check on this one.
Can you rebase on master?

If there is a plan to work on this, I would be happy to volunteer in some of the development/testing/etc. I do think this is an important change to airflow that would allow for much more adoption and maintainability. I know within Pandora, there is a huge need for this, since we have regulations for being a publicly traded company that certain datasets scheduled by airflow cannot be run/touched by any besides a subset of people, but others depend on these tables/can read from them, and they'd like to be able to check on the job and more through the UI. Like you all stated, the granularity is not there.
Let me know if there is a plan outlined anywhere to make this possible :)
Any updates? We are getting slowly to a 1.10 release and I know some ppl are really eager to try this out, like @Fokko .

@Acehaidrey Thank you for your support! I've been working on this feature off a [separate repo](https://github.com/wepay/airflow-webserver),  and plan to create an updated PR in Q1 so it can be merged back into the main repo, and then release it as an alpha version for Airflow 1.10. 

I am currently working on the PR (adding cli support and integrating the configurations to airflow.cfg), should be able to have it out before end of the week. 

It's also dependent on the latest FAB release, which will include [this commit](https://github.com/dpgaspar/Flask-AppBuilder/pull/694) in order to supports timezone.

Any testing/issue identified/contributions would be welcome!

@bolkedebruin I've recently been focusing on the Kubernetes Operator article (meeting with bloomberg's in-house tech writer with a completed first draft this Wednesday) so that should be ready for release soon.

WRT the executor, it's working on my local machine but it seems there are some minor issues with the travis build, so I'm going to investigate that tonight (hopefully it's a straightforward fix), but should have that fixed this week. If I can get the build fixed on travis, I would be glad to host a Q&A session to help early adopters get set up (or even just ask people to join kubernetes.slack.com where I can asynchronously answer questions).
Awesome @jgao54 thanks for taking on the big load :) I'm looking forward to trying it out when it's ready. I will definitely test and look for any issues etc. Let me know if I can help in any way
Please take a look @mistercrunch @kapil-malik
